etymology.description: semantic 艹(艹) (cǎo, "plant") + phonetic 矛(矛) (máo, "spear") = grass with long, pointed shape -> cogon grass
etymology.interpretation: The character 茅(máo) conveys its meaning as cogon grass through the plant radical 艹(艹) (cǎo, "plant") to signify vegetation, while 矛(矛) (máo, "spear") suggests its long, sharp shape.

examples.chinese: 村里的人们用茅盖房子(村裡的人們用茅蓋房子)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn lǐ de rénmen yòng máo gài fángzi.
examples.english: The villagers use cogon grass to thatch their houses.

examples.chinese: 那间茅屋充满古朴气息(那間茅屋充滿古樸氣息)。
examples.pinyin: Nà jiān máo wū chōngmǎn gǔpǔ qìxī.
examples.english: That cogon grass hut is full of rustic charm.

examples.chinese: 村庄外的山坡上长满了茅(村莊外的山坡上長滿了茅)。
examples.pinyin: Cūnzhuāng wài de shānpō shàng zhǎngmǎn le máo.
examples.english: The hillside outside the village is covered with cogon grass.
